DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Interphase Gain Outcome Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the value for the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body for fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH), a physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect the gain of interphases, the interval between two successive cell divisions during which the chromosomes are not individually distinguishable.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Interphase Gain Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body for fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH), a physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect the gain of interphases, the interval between two successive cell divisions during which the chromosomes are not individually distinguishable.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Interphase Gain Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: A type of IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION in which target sequences are stained with fluorescent dye so their location and size can be determined using fluorescence microscopy. This staining is sufficiently distinct that the hybridization signal can be seen both in metaphase spreads and in interphase nuclei.:The interval between two successive cell divisions during which the chromosomes are not individually distinguishable. Interphase is considered the resting stage of the cell.:Gain; to increase or the amount of increase.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.
The interval between two successive cell divisions during which the chromosomes are not individually distinguishable. Interphase is considered the resting stage of the cell.
Gain; to increase or the amount of increase.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the value for fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Value; a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
